pageContext.claim: “James Comey has been rebuked at the highest level, with much more to come. An IG Report doesn’t get any stronger, calling him dangerous, insubordinate.”
pageContext.analysis: The Justice Department Inspector General sharply rebuked the former FBI Director for his handling of memos he wrote about his conversations with Trump, in particular allowing one unclassified memo to be shared with a reporter. But Trump hypes up the criticism. This particular report did not say he was insubordinate --that was an earlier report regarding his handling of the Hillary Clinton email controversy -- and merely said Comey set a "dangerous example" for other FBI employees. "Comey had several other lawful options available to him to advocate for the appointment of a Special Counsel, which he told us was his goal in making the disclosure," the report concluded. "What was not permitted was the unauthorized disclosure of sensitive investigative information, obtained during the course of FBI employment, in order to achieve a personally desired outcome."
